description: c. 1300, from Middle English foretellen, equivalent to fore- +â€Ž tell.

verbs.description: foretell (third-person singular simple present foretells, present participle foretelling, simple past and past participle foretold)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To predict; to tell (the future) before it occurs; to prophesy.
(transitive) To tell (a person) of the future.
